title: Energy- gravitational PE of two systems

content.question: Which of the following is a correct statement regarding the amount of mechanical energy in the system consisting of only one ball at time <math alttext="t equals t sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The mechanical energy of Ball <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>X</mtext></mstyle></math> and the mechanical energy of Ball <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Y</mtext></mstyle></math> are equal at <math alttext="t equals t sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>.</mo></mstyle></math>

The mechanical energy of Ball <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Y</mtext></mstyle></math> is greater than the mechanical energy of Ball <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>X</mtext></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t equals t sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>.</mo></mstyle></math>

The mechanical energy of Ball <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>X</mtext></mstyle></math> is greater than the mechanical energy of Ball <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Y</mtext></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t equals t sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>.</mo></mstyle></math>
The mechanical energy of the two balls cannot be compared without knowing the initial speed of the two balls.

content.answer: The mechanical energy of Ball <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>X</mtext></mstyle></math> is greater than the mechanical energy of Ball <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Y</mtext></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t equals t sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>.</mo></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
